title: Effect of NLRP3 inflammasome genes polymorphism on disease susceptibility and response to TNF-α inhibitors in Iraqi patients with rheumatoid arthritis
summary: This study investigates the impact of polymorphisms in the NLRP3 and CARD8 genes on disease susceptibility and response to TNF-α inhibitors in Iraqi patients with rheumatoid arthritis (RA). In a cohort of 100 RA patients and 100 healthy controls, the analysis revealed no significant differences in genotype distributions of the CARD8 (rs2043211) and NLRP3 (rs4612666) SNPs between the two groups. However, increased serum levels of pro-inflammatory cytokines (TNF-α and IL-1β) correlated with higher disease activity scores (DAS-28). Notably, variant genotypes of CARD8 and NLRP3 were associated with a poorer response to anti-TNF-α therapy and higher disease activity. This suggests a potential role of these polymorphisms in influencing RA disease course and treatment outcomes.

study_parameters.Characteristics: Elevated TNF-α and IL-1β serum levels in non-responders
Patients classified into responders and non-responders based on EULAR criteria

var_drug_ann.Notes: CARD8 (rs2043211) TT genotype was more frequent in patients with higher DAS-28 (P < 0.0001) and higher TNF-α and IL-1β serum levels (P < 0.0001 for both).
var_drug_ann.Sentence: Genotype TT is associated with decreased response to Etanercept, Infliximab in people with Rheumatoid Arthritis.
Citations: CARD8 (rs2043211) TT genotype was more frequent in patients with higher DAS-28 (P < 0.0001) and higher TNF-α and IL-1β serum levels (P < 0.0001 for both).
Interestingly, this study revealed that CARD8 (rs2043211) and NLRP3 (rs4612666) variant genotypes are associated with lower response to anti-TNF-α drugs.

Patients with CARD8 (rs2043211) A allele bearing genotypes (wild homozygous and heterozygous genotypes) associated with lower DAS- as compared to those with T allele bearing genotypes (Variant homozygous genotypes and heterozygous genotypes).
